definition[0]: not working properly, or not made correctly
example[0]: Customers may ask for a refund if the goods are faulty.
example[1]: a faulty gene that causes breast cancer
definition[1]: a faulty way of thinking about something contains a mistake, so that you make a wrong decision
example[2]: an idea based on a faulty understanding of biology
definition[2]: if a machine, system etc is faulty, there is something wrong with it that prevents it from working correctly
example[3]: Owners of affected cars can go to their dealerships to have the faulty part replaced.
